tournament.name: Main Event - Eternal Weekend Europe 2024 (J.K. Entertainment GmbH)

decks.notes: The deck aims to quickly assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo by using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill cards and put Narcomoeba into play. By using cards like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle, the deck can win the game in a single turn by drawing the entire library. Control elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares are included to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and card selection, making the deck versatile and powerful in interacting with various matchups in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through various forms of interaction like counterspells, removal, and hand disruption. It also aims to control the game's tempo by utilizing powerful card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils. Additionally, it includes threats like Timeless Dragon and Murktide Regent to apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base is constructed to support the deck's triple color requirement and includes utility lands like Geier Reach Sanitarium for additional card advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and dictate the pace of play.

This deck focuses on utilizing creature tutoring spells like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key combo pieces like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Nomads en-Kor. The strategy revolves around generating mana quickly with cards like Noble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle to power out explosive plays, such as casting a Craterhoof Behemoth for a massive finish. Additionally, the deck includes protection in the form of Sylvan Safekeeper and counter hate with cards like Allosaurus Shepherd and Collector Ouphe. This deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently while maintaining board control and protecting its win condition.

The deck focuses on generating fast mana through spells like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to cast a large enough storm count for a lethal Tendrils of Agony. It includes a variety of cantrip spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for combo pieces and protect the combo with disruption like Duress and Thoughtseize. Burning Wish is used to find versatile sideboard cards for specific matchups, while Past in Flames provides recursion for combo pieces already used. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game in one explosive turn.

The key concept of this deck revolves around using creatures like Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create a powerful combo that allows for explosive plays with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling to quickly assemble your win condition, Craterhoof Behemoth. Utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Gaea's Cradle and Noble Hierarch, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Collector Ouphe, this deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of creatures and finishing them off with a massive, game-winning attack.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering and disrupting the opponent's strategy while also utilizing the combo of Phyrexian Dreadnought and Abhorrent Oculus for a quick win. With a variety of disruption spells like Stifle, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will, as well as card draw and manipulation through Brainstorm, Ponder, and Tamiyo, this deck aims to stay ahead of the opponent and maintain board control. The inclusion of Curie, Emergent Intelligence and Tamiyo offer additional card advantage and utility, making this deck versatile and adaptable in different matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-ending combo. With a mix of control elements like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Daze to protect the combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats early in the game. The land base is designed to support the deck's game plan while disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland.

The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost lands and various ramp spells like Crop Rotation and Once Upon a Time, in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog. Disruptor Flute and Karn, the Great Creator are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Vexing Bauble and The One Ring provide extra utility. The deck also includes lands like Glacial Chasm and Bojuka Bog for protection and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and versatile spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Elvish Reclaimer, Wight of the Reliquary, and Gaea's Cradle to control the board and search for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. With access to cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can quickly tutor for and play powerful threats. Endurance and Once Upon a Time provide additional flexibility and utility, while cards like Collector Ouphe disrupt opponent strategies. Overall, the deck aims to ramp up mana quickly, control the board, and overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures.

The key concept of this Doomsday combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday and set up a winning pile of cards to win the game. The deck aims to efficiently cycle through the library with cards like Street Wraith, Brainstorm, and Ponder, while also protecting the combo with Force of Will and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. Once Doomsday is cast, the deck aims to win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries by manipulating the top of the library. The deck is designed to quickly and efficiently execute the combo to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Doomsday combo deck is to efficiently stack your deck using cards like Personal Tutor and Doomsday, then utilize Thassa's Oracle to win the game with a library of exactly one card left. The deck also incorporates a mix of cantrips, fast mana, and disruption to protect the combo and ensure a quick and consistent win. It aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces and execute the combo, while also being able to disrupt opponents' game plans through counter magic and hand disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then reanimate them onto the battlefield with cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate. The deck aims to cheat out big, game-winning creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Wasteland and Fatal Push to deal with opponent's threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifacts and Eldrazi to control the game and disrupt the opponent's plays. It includes cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator to provide board control, while Trinisphere and Disruptor Flute slow down the opponent. The aim is to establish a strong board presence through Urza lands and powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Grim Monolith. The deck also includes Emrakul, the Aeons Torn as a finisher to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and Urza's Tower, allowing for explosive plays and the ability to cast powerful spells like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes various tools to disrupt opponents and protect your combo pieces, such as Crop Rotation, Karn, the Great Creator, and Bojuka Bog. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to cast big threats like Emrakul or lock opponents out of the game with cards like Planar Nexus and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale.

The main focus of this deck is to generate massive amounts of mana with Gaea's Cradle and use it to ramp into powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Wight of the Reliquary. The deck also utilizes control elements like Endurance and Sylvan Safekeeper to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own creatures. With cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, the deck can search for specific creatures to suit the situation. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while ramping into powerful threats to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting opponent's strategies by utilizing Lands as key components. By using cards like Life from the Loam to recur lands, Urza's Saga to provide additional value, and a combination of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful creature, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through careful resource management and land manipulation. With the ability to lock down opponents' mana sources and disrupt their game plan, the deck seeks to establish dominance over the battlefield and sculpt the game to its advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize various artifact synergies to quickly ramp up mana and generate card advantage, ultimately leading to a powerful combo win condition using Mystic Forge to cast cards from the top of the library. The deck includes key pieces such as Voltaic Key and Grim Monolith to generate extra mana, and Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for key artifacts. The deck also includes control elements such as Pithing Needle and Kozilek's Command to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly get powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using various reanimation spells like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. Key cards like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty are used to generate massive card advantage and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also includes cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to accelerate the process of getting big creatures onto the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early, powerful threats and disrupt their game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize.

Utilize powerful graveyard recursion strategies to quickly bring out high-impact creatures and disrupt opponents' game plans, while also having a backup plan of cheating out creatures with Show and Tell. The deck aims to win through overwhelming board presence and card advantage, using cards like Reanimate, Entomb, and Animate Dead to fuel its game plan. With efficient removal and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck seeks to control the game while setting up its combo. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly mill through the library and graveyard to set up a win condition with Thassa's Oracle or a reanimated creature. Utilizing fast mana, discard spells, and combo pieces like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy, the deck aims to cycle through cards rapidly and efficiently. The inclusion of counterspells and disruption cards helps protect the combo pieces and ensure a smooth win. By effectively managing resources and timing spells, the deck can execute its game plan and achieve victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on generating massive amounts of mana by utilizing Cloudpost lands and ramp spells like Crop Rotation and Ancient Stirrings. It aims to assemble the Tron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to cast big Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger quickly. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility by shutting down opponent's artifacts, and The One Ring can create a powerful threat on its own. The deck includes disruptive elements like Swords to Plowshares and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt opponents.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Coveted Jewel combo, using cards like Transmute Artifact and Copy Artifact to find and duplicate the Jewel. Once the Coveted Jewel is in play, the deck can generate large amounts of mana with Grim Monolith, Lotus Petal, and Mox Opal to cast powerful spells like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or use Paradox Engine to further abuse the mana. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's gameplan while establishing a strong board presence quickly. By using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats, along with Aether Vial to cheat out creatures, the deck aims to control the game while steadily applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Spirit of the Labyrinth. The inclusion of cards like Magus of the Moon and Wasteland also allows for additional disruption, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize.

This Legacy Goblins deck is heavily focused on rapidly deploying and sacrificing Goblins for value. Utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey and Munitions Expert, the deck seeks to swarm the board and deal damage quickly. Cards such as Muxus, Goblin Grandee and Battle Cry Goblin can provide explosive turns, while Aether Vial allows for instant speed creature deployment. The deck also has a strong mana denial aspect with cards like Wasteland and can generate additional value through sacrificing creatures with cards like Sling-Gang Lieutenant. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive Goblin tribal strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of lands and various control cards. It aims to slow down the opponent's strategy with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Wasteland, while also disrupting their game plan with Pithing Needle and Ghost Quarter. The deck also has a strong land package with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful threats. By managing the board state and resource denial, this deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a victory through attrition and strategic play.

The deck aims to generate infinite mana through a combination of artifacts like Basalt Monolith, Grim Monolith, and Voltaic Key to power abilities such as Mystic Forge and The One Ring. This allows for explosive plays and combos with cards like Paradox Engine and Karn, the Great Creator. Glaring Fleshraker acts as a creature win condition while Urza's Saga provides utility and search for key artifacts. The deck's reliance on artifact synergy and mana ramping sets it apart from traditional combo decks, making it a unique and powerful archetype in Legacy format.

This deck utilizes the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill their opponent's deck. It also includes disruptive elements like Pyroblast, Red Elemental Blast, and Swords to Plowshares to control the game. The deck is designed to quickly assemble the combo pieces while using cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Enlightened Tutor to find them efficiently. Broadside Bombardiers and Fury provide additional removal options, while Urza's Saga helps to find key artifacts. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up the combo for a quick win.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful disruptive spells and creatures like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to stifle the opponent's strategy while efficiently drawing cards and managing resources with cards like Brainstorm and Dress Down. By utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver opponents by controlling the flow of the game and steadily gaining advantage until victory is achieved.
